cyclone.name: HAROLD
cyclone.current_location: about 375 mi ESE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving quickly west toward the south-central Texas coast, then inland across southern Texas and northern Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south Texas coast (roughly between Port Mansfield and Port O’Connor)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of Rio Grande to Port O'Connor, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Texas coastline and adjacent northern Mexico coastline
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty winds well below tropical-storm force possible Tuesday, otherwise light to breezy.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the Lake Charles area.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could produce 1–2 inches of rain, locally higher in brief downpours.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased rip-current risk along southwest Louisiana beaches.
